text: To find foxes,
you will need to go to either a taiga,
giant taiga, or a snowy taiga biome.
Foxes are nocturnal mobs,

which means they are more
likely to spawn at night,
but you can also find them during the day.
To tame a fox,

you will need to breed
two foxes together first.

To do this, you will need
to have sweet berries,

which can be found within
any taiga biome variant.
Along with the sweet berries,

you will also need to make
sure you have two leads.
Make sure you are crouching around foxes,
or else they will run away from you.

Try to find and capture
two foxes using your leads,

and make sure you're
crouching while doing so.

After you've captured both
foxes using the leads,
contain them in a small area
by surrounding them using any block.
Make sure the walls around them
are at least two blocks high.
Once they are contained,
you can remove the leads,
and you don't have to crouch anymore.

Give each fox a sweet
berry for them to breed.
Then a baby fox will spawn.
Wait for the baby fox to grow up.
You can feed it sweet berries
to speed up the growth process.

After a while, the baby
should be a grown-up fox.
You can then remove the walls.
Both of the foxes that bred will escape,
and the baby fox will not run away
because it's tamed.
However, foxes are not like cats and dogs.

After taming them, they
won't run away from you,
but they will not follow you.
The only way to take a tamed fox with you
is by using a lead or a boat.
